oai_dc:dc.dc:title: der Vogelfanger: HYBRIDIZING BIRDS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Griffith, Joseph G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Until recently the reasons for hybridizingmight reasonably have been construedas "intellectual". Most hybridizers wereinterested in crosses for the curiositiesproduced, for improving song or color,or to establish a new kind of bird. Today,with the scarcity of birds and the resultantrise in prices, hybridizing can be theonly way out in an effort to maintain aspecies for which a mate isn't readilyavailable. The choice here is to use acl.osely related bird in the hope of obtainingfertile hybrids or to wait until a birdof the species required is available. In thelatter case, the wait may be indefinite.
